docs.lead_paragraph: Attacking what it regards as mislabeling of low-cholesterol foods, the Food and Drug Administration yesterday assailed three large food concerns, including the Procter & Gamble Company. Just last month the agency said Procter & Gamble had misrepresented processed orange juice as fresh, and yesterday it attacked the company's Crisco Corn Oil, CPC International Inc.'s 100% Pure Mazola Corn Oil and Great Foods of America Inc.'s Heartbeat Canola Oil.
